text:
50cl Bottle @ The Beer Garden Store, Madrid, Spain.
Dark brown colour with a thin tan head.
Aroma is malt, caramel, chocolate, nuts, hints of herbs.
Taste is malt, caramel, nuts, toffee.
Full body, average carbonation.
500ml Bottle. Deep brown with light off white head. Slight peat nose with malty notes. Medium body with a strong peat flavour and smoky background.

From bottle at muted horn Berlin. Pours dark brown with hints of red. Nose of malt loaf, red fruit, resin, spices. Taste is biscuits, resin, bread, gingerbread, smokey, savoury, sausage,  dry finish. Really nice, complex.

BOTTLE 50 CL. Dark ruby, frothy beige head. Rich malty aroma, molasses and notes of dark fruit, light smoked cheese notes. Similar taste, rich creamy malts with only moderate sweetness, soft smoked cheese. Silky mouthfeel. Very low bitterness, yet the beer feels perfectly balanced. Very nice.
Brown, low head. Aroma toffee, herbal Palate medium, medium carbonation Taste estery fruity, banana, cloves, herbs, caramel. Balanced, peppery finish. Outstanding.

#1310Tap. Very dark brown body, medium beige head. Aroma of chocolate, nuts, caramel. Taste is semi-dry, sweetish-bitter finish. Warming alcohol, chocolate, pralines, liqueur, nuts. Full body, medium carbonation. OK, very good brewjob, I like it so much! :)

Bottle from secret Santa. Many thanks. Brown colour, almost no head, wood. Aroma is malty, sweet, caramel, bisquity. Taste is malty, wood, a bit sour. Overall well balanced and drinkable. Clean. Good one.
Bottle at a tasting. Quite tasty, balanced. Woody, caramelly, honeyish. Med sweetness, light bitterness, very light tannins. Relatively tasty and easy drinking.

Draught at BeerGeek Bar. Cloudy, dark red to brown colored. AROMA- roasted malts, chocolate, pleasant alcohol. FLAVOR- slightly sweet, bitter, warming alcohol presence, chocolate bonbon with liqueur of sweet box. Full bodied. Delicious.

Bottle thanks to allmyvinyl. 
Appearance - dark brown with some orangey chinks. Thin off-white head.
Nose - sweet malt, toffee, nuts. 
Taste - burnt bread, then into toffee, light spice. 
Palate - medium bodied with a creamy texture and a fairly balanced finish.
Overall - it tastes like a Scotch ale, or a really big doppelbock.

Bottle from drygate, shared with Ashton McCobb. Pours clear ruby brown with a thick off-white head. Aromas of heavy dark malt, faint herbal. Taste is light herbal, more dark sweet malt and toffee. Almost a Scotch ale. Clean finish. Wowzer.
From Miguel. In Teku glass. After dinner. Thanks God it has a soft smoky touch that helps in drinking it slower,because its high ABV is really well concealed and its 50cl

Ecco una birra veramente ben fatta! Aspetto perfetto, colore marrone scuro con schiuma quasi pannosa. Complessa sia al naso che in bocca, con sentori maltati, passiti, un po liquorosi e altro ancora. Averne!

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2017 Aus der Flasche getrunken (Muted Horn). Dunkles Altkupfer mit weißem stabilem Schaum im Glas. Komplexe Malzigkeit dominiert. Im Nachtrunk etwas pfeffrig. Der überzogenen Alkoholanteil ist gut eingebunden. Körper setzt sich spät durch.

500ml bottle
Deep brown color with sudsy head.
Malty aroma with strong sticking plaster/medicinal phenolic.
Sweet creamy palate, malty with slight bitterness and a touch of sourness.
Interesting beer.

Restrained aroma in a deep brown black pour. Interestingly different flavor profile with the laid back hop malt balance enhanced with a subtle hint of smoke and wood. Manages to hide its not inconsiderable strength too - with could make it a little dangerous.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

On tap @Ma che siete venuti a fà (Rome). Ambrata carica/bruna, con schiuma beige non molto persistente. Al naso sentori di malto, caramello, zucchero di canna, caramella dorzo, luppolo (erbaceo). In bocca è dolce con base di malto esagerata e un finale luppolato leggero, un po sbilanciata. Corpo pieno, carbonazione medio-leggera. Un po grezza, ma ok.

Kolor:  Brązowy, dość czysty. 
 Piana:  Kremowa, drobno i średnio pęcherzykowata. 
Spory czas wisi nad piwiem. Pozostawia liczne wstęgi na krawędziach.
Po zakręceniu szkłem brudzi każdy jego centymetr. 
 Zapach:  Aromat jest wyraźnie słodowy z odpowiednią dawką chmielu z tyłu.
Czuć karmel, przypieczoną skórkę chlebową i odrobinę ciemnych owoców.
Na dalekim zapleczu nuty czekolady. 
 Smak:  W smaku intensywnie słodowe z melanoidami, przypieczoną skórką chlebową, karmelem.
Na drugim planie delikatna wędzonka drzewna. Przez jakiś czas przewinęła się nuta śliwek wędzonych.
Owocowy profil jest stonowany, można się też doszukać delikatnych rodzynek i brązowego cukru.
Alkohol subtelnie rozgrzewa, ale nie przeszkadza.
Goryczka jest średniej siły, lekko pikantne tło.
Pół wytrawne, średnio wysycone, z gęstą, zbitą teksturą.
Mocne, konkretne, słodowe Ale. 
 Wysycenie: Średnie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Kooperacja Freigeist z Nøgne.

Nie mam dużego doświadczenia z tym stylem.
Wiem jednak na pewno, że jest to najlepszy Alt jakiego piłem.
Mocno słodowy, konkretny z duża porcją karmelu, melanoidów, lekką dymną nutą, stonowaną owocowością i kapką brązowego cukru.
Niesamowite jest ukrycie 11% alkoholu.
Współpraca niemiecko-norweska na 5-kę z plusem!

bottle. Dark brown with a small off-white head. Fruity hints in the nose, also caramel and chocolate. Full-bodied, malty with roasetd malts, caramel, dried fruit, some chocolate. Hints of berries with a tart and wild, yeasty touch. Unusual, good.
Bottle form the importer. This is another example to make old style like new one.

Bottle at home shared with Rachel before hitting the toon. Pours deep Amber with a White head. Pronounced malty aroma with a slightly fruity edge and a touch of smoke. Caramel/toffee flavour. A very full flavoured beer.
Old rating from CBC 2014. Beer in the glass brownish, small head. Malty-smokey aroma. Starts malty-spicy, a bit smokey. Light hints of caramel and syrup. Light sweetish background. Interesting.
Dark golden brown, offwhite lace. Roast, a tad phenolic and oxidized, roast sugar, medium full dark sugar base, light choc, some liquor, toffee finish.

Aroma: pumpernickel, caramel, melanoidines.
Appearance: hazy deep amber color and creamy head.
Taste: medium herbal bitterness, roasted dark malts, caramel, melanoidines, demarara sugar, semi-dry.
Palate: full body and medium carbonation, warming finish.
Overall: It is a great alt, complex and balanced, great demarara notes.

(Bottle, 0.5 l, at Pikkulintu, 20161116) The beer poured black. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had chocolate, toasted malts and sweetness. Palate was full bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were toasted malts, molasses, caramel, grass and bitterness. Aftertaste was sweet, malty and bitter. A confusing brew: partly an Altbier, partly a barley wine.

07-11-16 // 500ml bottle at home. Pours a deep brown to black beer. Small beige head. Nose is alcoholic malty. Taste is strong malty, some roasted malts, light chocolate, light cherry. Alcoholic notes in the end. Powerful but smooth.
Hazy dark amber, offwhite froth. Malty aroma, some caramel and notes of smoke. Sweetish, malty flavour.

At Ghent Beer Festival. Pours hazy amber with a frothy off-white head. The aroma contains caramel, wood, hay, smoke and grass. It tastes medium bitter and medium sweet. Rich, roasted aftertaste. Alcohol is well hidden but becomes warming after a while. Medium body, oily texture and soft carbonation.

Draft sample at De Prael during Carnival Brettanomyces 2016. Amsterdam, The Netherlands. 24.06.2016. Pour it dark reddish color with small white head. Aroma roasted and smoked malts. Taste sweet caramel, some strange funky sweetness, smoked in the middle, after taste smoked feel. Really perfect and strange in a good way. Bravo

Thx and taste with Thierry and Lode on Gents Beer Festival 20.08.16.
Strange brown color, with a beige head. 
Aroma: smoked, roasted, sweet malts. Medium almost full body.
Taste: sweet, smoked, caramel, sour, some coffee and chocolate bit dried fruits.

20/VIII/16 - 33cl bottle @ Gents Bierfestival - BB: 23/VII/15 (2016-897) 
Clear purple brown beer, aery irregular beige head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: pretty roasted, some sweet malts, bit nutty, sourish touch, some coffee? MF: ok carbon, medium to full body. Taste: sweet start, coffee, mocha, some chocolate, bit sweet. Aftertaste: hoppy, coffee, caramel, some dried fruits.
Pours a brown colour. Taste is malty and boozy. Tasted at Gents Bier Festival 2016

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2016 Collab of Nogne O and Freigeist brewed at Vormann, intended as an imperial Alt, tasted at GBF. Irregular, moussy, pale greyish beige head over a deep brown-bronze copper coloured beer. Aroma of hazelnuts, caramel, burnt toast, smoked ham, burnt pipe tobacco, dried fig. Dried fruits in the mouth, restrainedly sweetish, very nutty malt middle with a caramelly sweetish edge but altogether on the dryish side, hayish and herbal (almost tea-like) hop bitterness in the end along with lingering toasted malt bittersweetness, the smoked meat factor returning and warming brandyish alcohol. Recognizably Alt in its core, but evidently at imperial ABV level. Altbier is seldom countered by modern craft brewers and if anyone is to do it, I guess Freigeist is the right candidate for the job. This one indeed extends the limits of the style while at the same time being conservative in keeping the typical nutty maltiness of a classic Alt intact. Beautifully done from a style and technical point of view - and a tasty beer in general.
Brown with soapy head. Aroma and flavour have light smoke and caramel malts. Has a subtle sweetness.

No head to speak of over beautiful ruby-brown beer. Smoked malt traceable from a mile distance; German dark bread, meatroast. Sweet-mineral, with again a rustiness and the smoked meat, much milder at first, but growing in the finish. Medium bodied, very slick. Some alcohol. Not half bad!

Thank you for sharing! Sampled 500 ml. bottle @ Gents Bierfestival 2016. Red copper brown, little tanned head. Nose is super thick smoked, smoked wood, smoked tea, syrup, smoked syrup & some gravy. Taste is intense thick smoke, gravy, campfire wood, low umami, Lapsang Souchong, heavily smoked gravy malt,.. Body is gravy, thick almost syrup, smoke, Almost too much but neat interesting nearly overkill beer going as far as gravy & etc. notes.
A very solid alt beer. Richly sweet. Super malty. A little sourness, but mostly plum, caramel, and bread. Tried at the Oedipus International beer festival in 2016.

An impertial alt, how cool is that. Interesting stuff, really is. Sweet, great smoke flavor, especially in the beginning.

At the Oedipus International Beer Festival

On tap at the Oedipus International Beer Festival 2016, Amsterdam - day#2 (03-Jul-2016). Reddish brown in colour with a small beige coloured head. Aroma of malt, spices and caramel.  Medium body and soft carbonation. Light bitter taste of dark fruit and malt. Slightly smoked. Smooth - disguises the ABV really well.

On tap @ Oedipus Int. Beer Festival 2016. Nose is malty. Body is clear deep amber, head is very small, beige, mostly diminishing, good lacing. Aroma is light smoke, spices, herbs, leaves. Medium sweet, light bitter, slightly sourish. Finish is medium lasting fruity medium bittersweet. Medium body, slick texture, soft carbonation. Quite easy, interesting, not bad.
Draft at brett fest in Prael. Aroma of sweet roasted malt mostly. Taste has sweet malt, red fruit, oak and soft roast. Bit boozy. Solid.
Tap at De Prael. Dark reddish brown. Sweet coffee, dog, hay, milk chocolate, French herbs. Medium sweet. Under medium bodied with soft carbonation.
Draft at De Prael. Dark clear amber brown, tan head. Aroma of concentrated caramel. Taste is sweet toffee and caramel.
An amber beer with a lazing beige head. The aroma has notes of caramel, beech wood smoke, ans caramel. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, lemons, and caramel, leading to a bitter finish.
birra assolutamente pazzesca, da bere con attenzione perché va giù troppo in fretta

Bottle: Cloudy, amber coloured with a reddish sheen, mid-sized and slowly collapsing creamy off-white head; moderate to solid sourish-fruity, cellary nose, but also chocolatey, caramelly and woody aromas detectable; nearly solid sweet-bitter flavour, full bodied as expected; lingering sweet-bitter finish of csramel, vanilla and dried fruits. A liquid "Schwarzwaelder Kirsch" cake

Glass, 4-ounce, bottle, during the Mondial de la bière, savoured on June 11 2015; eye: mahogany, hazy, no effervescence, tiny ring of beige head, no lacing; nose: malt, smoke, caramel, light hops; mouth: malt, smoke, caramel, light hops, mild astringency, surprisingly bitter, lightly sweet, finale in smoke with presence of caramel, medium-full body, lightly silky texture; overall: fine

FRANÇAIS

Verre, 4 onces, bouteille, lors du Mondial de la bière, savourée le 11 juin 2015; il : acajou, trouble, pas deffervescence, minuscule anneau de mousse beige, pas de dentelle; nez : malt, fumé, caramel, léger houblon; bouche : malt, fumé, caramel, léger houblon, astringence moyenne, curieusement amère, légèrement sucrée, finale en fumé avec présence de caramel, corps moyen-corsé, texture légèrement soyeuse; en résumé : bien

500ml bottle pours a dark brown color with a small off-white head that leaves a few spots of lacing behind. Aroma is light smoke with earthy tones and caramel. Taste is an earthiness with some light smoke and a caramel malty sweetness. Light to medium bodied with mild carbonation. A very unique beer, unlike anything I have ever had before. Although it is interesting, just not for my tastes.

Ambar oscura de espuma beige no muy abundante. Aroma malteado y algo de frutos secos. En boca es también claramente malteada, toffe, bizcocho. Bien de gas, alcohol bien presente y cuerpo. Ligero amargor. Final también malteado.

(bottle, label says: brewed at Göller, Zeil, crown cap is Vormann, Hagen, bb: 12/2015) Hazy, mahogany colour with a beige medium-sized foamy head. Mildly yeasty and toasted malty aroma with notes of chocolate, toffee, leather, liquorice and a sour-fruity touch of red berries and cassis. Sweet flavour with a tinge of acidity in the background, almost full bodied with a smooth carbonation. Moderately toasted malty base with primary notes of chocolate and toffee, backed by a mildly sourish berry-fruity touch, which I´d normally define as early stages of infection; mildly sweet and sour-fruity finish with lasting notes of chocolate, toffee and leather. 09.III.15

Fast klare dunkel orangebraune Farbe, geringe beige Schaumkrone. Geruch kräftig röstmalzig, viel Restsüße, Karamell, rauchig. Geschmack rauchig, Schinken, kräftig malzig, Karamell, alkoholisch, viel Schinken im Abgang, interessant!

500 ml bottle from Les Vignerons. Dark copper, quite hazy, with a small, relatively persistent beige head. Pretty intense nose: toffe, estery notes, red mature fruits, slightly smoky too and moderately boozy. Overall earthy and malty. Taste follow suite, rich malty taste (dark bread, burnt caramel) tiny fruity and almost balsamic astringency, mild warming sensation. Chestnuts and dark honey in the aftertaste. Ridicolous drinkability considering the ABV. Soft carbonation, medium to full body, slightly oily texture. Not my kind of beer, but certainly well made.

sample from cask at mondial de la bière 2015 - mtl. unclear light brown orange with a small reviving light beige cap, some lacing. sweet molassed brown malts, peated caramel, smoky and bitter berries - never acrid and with a touch of their acidity; lots of dried fruits, very chalky and mineral, black tea, alcohol. light carbonation, medium-full body - oily; semi-sweet, astringent caramel-woodsy-smoky-umami finish. unique. complex smoked dried fruit cake. enjoyed!

A dark reddish copper alt with a very thin light mocha head. In aroma, sweet fruity caramel malt with loads of dark fruits, molasses, meat notes, a tad off. In mouth, a sweet fruity malt with loads of smoked malt, grassy hops, dark fruits, plums, licorice notes, alcohol warmth, nice. Bottle at Mondial 2015.

Shared bottle at Crete tasting at Bossa Nova Restaurant, Gerani. Pours murky brown with no head at all. Aroma is malty, dark weak roasted bread and toffee, and also a weak sour tarty note. Smooth mouthfeel.Taste is sweet caramel and loads of spicy sweet alcohol. Gets smoother as the beer warms up, but still not a real pleasure imo.

Unattractive murky dark brown appearance. Ripe fruit and woodsmoke in the nose. Palate is smooth, velvety, light carbo. Lots of tastes jumping out here, with no dominant flavour. Sour fruit, banana, malt and some smokiness. Obviously a hybrid brew that I wouldve rated higher if it wasnt so ugly.
Shared bottle . Dark amber colour. Malty, caramel aroma. Malty, fruity, caramel flavour.

Bottle from Brewery Creek, VancouverDark brown color, with small head. Deep aroma, a lot of caramel, with that typical accent of old house, although it seems sweeter and a bit fruitier than a classic Altbier. Good body strength; the malt flavor and caramel are strong, its moderately sweet, there is some sucre candi, the bitterness level is quite high, and it presents a lit of fruity esters; the alcohol is evident too, not boozy, but it provides a nice warmth; if one thing, I would remove that very light sourness.The Uerige Doppelsticke comes to mind; the malt is comparable, this one has less American hopping, and it has a light dusty note.An excellent brewjob indeed.
Non il miglior lavoro brassicolo di sempre, ma sicuramente unottima birra. Prevale un impatto di malto, addolcito con note citriche e unimpronta caramellata e di toffee.
Bottle. dark amber color. Malt and hints of caramel and smoke in the aroma. Malty sweet, liquorish flavor with hints of citrus, plums and smoke. Decent, the balance is better as expected.

Smooth liquorice nose, fruity. The beer starts intense thick, lots of fruit. Fresh, but still viscous. Thick, plums, red dry cherries, intense heavy. Great thick and not too bitter brew. Not alcoholic at all!
Thanks erzengel! Pours cloudy amber with a small head. The is caramel, citrus, toasted malt. The is tart fruit, caramel, citrus ending dry. Medium body with carbonation.
Aroma is caramel, nutty malts, fruit and a hint o citrus. The flavor is malts, tobacco, dark fruit, mild nuttiness, citrus and a mix of sweetness and sour/tart in the finish.

500 ml bottle from Party Source shared. Pours a hazy orange amber brown color with a thin off white head. The aroma and flavor have a ton of malts; caramel, roast, fruity, hints of smoked wood, medium plus body, worth trying, but I probably wouldnt buy this again.

Color caoba oscuro con espuma beis ligera y uniforme. Aromas de intensidad media de frutas confitadas, caramelo y, más matizado, chocolate y tabaco. Cuerpo medio, inició dulce y afrutado intenso al que sigue un toque de chocolate que pasa a un final suavemente seco de tabaco y ligeramente tostado.

500ml bottle. Clear, deep copper-ish, brown colour with average, frothy, fairly lasting, minimally lacing, beige head. Smoky, roasty, caramel malty aroma, a nuttily touch, hints of herbal liqueur. Taste is intense malty, caramel sweetness, roast, smoke, hints of Brazil nut, herbal liqueur; oily texture, slightly sticky palate. Well hidden alcohol, surprisingly drinkable.

Bottle, 30/01/15. Pours a reddish brown with a small, off-white head. Aroma is very malty. Bready, dark, heavy bread, some nuts there too. Light yeast and light sour. Taste somewhat sweet, malt bread, heavy dark malt bread again. Light syrup, some nuts. More yeast here, light sour. Dark fruitiness is strong, prune. Fairly full with decent carbonation.

Clear amber brown colour, off-white head. Aroma caramel, hops, malts. Malty flavour, hops, caramel. Finish caramel, malts, light lingering bitterness.(from draught @ CBC green session, Copenhagen 2014. Thanks for sharing todays beers, RateBeer crew!)

500 ml bottle. Pours a clear mahogany color with light head. Aromas of dried herbs/flowers, raisins, dark tea, and dry toasted malts. Flavors of strong tea, light smoke, toasted breadcrusts and light herbs. Dry and somewhat acidic. Interesting.
UPDATED: JAN 25, 2015 Tourbe et sucre au nez, un peu de fumée. Couleur sombre, peu de mousse. Tourbe revien legerement avec ça note sucree. Le fumee revient apres. L?alcool est plutot bien cache.

Smell of raisins, alcohol. Muddy bronze colour, beige head. Aroma of oak, raisins, brandy. Some alcohol burning. Bitter, faint alcohol sweetness. Oily texture. Surprisingly lively carbon. Quite good.. But not the best brewjob ever. ;)
Kristiansand Øl Festival 2014. Dark amber colour with a beige head. Aroma is alcohol, caramel, malt, oxidation. Flavour is alcohol, caramel, nuts, bread, malt. Nice beer.

Bottle - Sweet caramel, light plum and light booze. Clearish amber brown with a thin white head. Caramel, light smoke, raisin, plum and other dark fruits. Smoke is prevalent throughout with lots of dark fruit and I really like the complexity here.

500mL bottle, pours a dark mahogany with a small tan head. Nose is quite strong, with caramel malts, some earthy notes, German lager yeast, and toasted bread. Flavour is along the same lines, with caramel malt, earthy notes and German lager yeast, ending on notes of toasted bread and a little alcohol heat. I was a little skeptical that this could work, but this ended up being quite enjoyable. Very nice.

Draught at CBC 2014. Clear copper liquid with a medium off-white head. Aroma of raw sugar, toffee, citrus, tangerine and booze. Taste is light sweet and medium bitter with notes of smoke, raw sugar and toffee. Medium bodied with low to medium carbonation. Meh, nothing special at all.
Dark brown body with a large offwhite head. Aroma of caramel, raisin, alcohol, herbs and grass. Taste is malty with a sweet toffee sting, floral hops, licorice, bittersweet finish.

Sample @ Kristiansand ølfestival. Clear amber body with a small sized, lacing beige head. Nice aroma of malt, caramel and dry fruit with a hint of bread and alcohol. Flavor is strong and rich with sweet malt, caramel, bread, dry fruit and warming alcohol, moderate in bitterness. Full bodied with a long, sweet and warming aftertaste. Quite pleasant in smaller amounts. Alcohol is not exactly hidden, but more pleasant and warming than boozy.

UPDATED: DEC 24, 2014 0,5 l bottle with a Vormann Brauerei cap. Clear dark ruby with a small, soapy, slowly diminishing, tan head. Intense, malty aroma of dark fruits, molasses and candy sugar with hints of smoke. Taste is of dark fruits, smoke, molasses and candy sugar. Just a slightly bitter finish. The alcohol cannot be recognised. Full body, chewish mouthfeel, low carbonation. Overall very deep and complex. The sweet malty taste is superbly balanced with those wonderful smokey flavours. The beer itself seems like a smoked Doppelbock (it is labeled as an Imperial Altbier). More of that please!
50 cl bottle @ home. Pours brownish amber with an off-white head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma and flavour are malt, caramel, and a little smoke - with a slightly dry finish.

500ml bottle at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki. Dark copper - red color with off white head. Malty aroma, almond, caramel, fruity. Taste is sweet and light bitter, malty caramel, light roasted. Light to medium oily body with soft carbonation.

UPDATED: AUG 18, 2016 Dark brown, beige foam ring. Nuts, alcohol and caramel notes in the taste and nose as well as some aggressive light soapy alcoholic touch and some roasted notes. Soapy acidic layer in the aftertaste.
This is huge. Roasted malt aromas, bitter coffee, sweetness, bacon, bitter chocolate everything. Sweet heavy body. Not as ultra dark as an imperial stout would be. Really an Imperial Alt. Nice!
0,5l bottle from Erzbierschof. I usually don?t like imperial style beers, but this one does the job. Has all the characteristics that you would expect from an imperial and from an alt.
500 ml. bottle. Pours reddish brown with an average beige head. Aroma of malt, caramel, and smoke. Taste is malt, dark fruit, caramel, and smoke. Doesnt live up to the name.
Rauchig, malzig, alkoholisch süß in der Nase. Süßlich, malzig, rauchig und leicht alkolisch am Gaumen. Schönes Teil.

A dark brown, slightly reddish beer, a head is medium and beige. The nose has dark and rich dried fruits, bread, some liquirice. Good and intensive aroma. Taste has rich and dried fruits and dark bread, some salt and liquirice, also some bitterness in the end. Medium+ bodied, medium carbonation, surprisingly fresh. Interesting and unique, powerful, bready with dried fruits.

500 ml bottle. Pours a dark amber colour with a small head. Aroma is very strong with bready maltiness, spiciness and meat. Flavour of sweet rich maltiness, smoke, spiciness, bread, meat, strong grassy bitterness, wood and some licorice. Nice wet earthiness as it warms up a bit. Full bodied. Very well balanced. Overall a very meaty brew. Brilliant.

Flaske på Mandag i annen (Cardinal) okt-14: mørk rubin med højt beige skum. Mye malt og noe vinøst over denne, men mitt fininnstilte apparat detekterer noe røykmalt eller brent brød som balanserer barleywine-sødmen på en interssant måte. The best brewjob - things must be getting a bit dodgy at the Nude Island!

Bottle from Bier-Deluxe.de. Unclear Chestnut brown color with medium beige head. Aroma of dark malt and caramel. Sweet dark malty taste with caramel, roasted notes, chocolate. Alcohol is present but not in distrubing way. Good.
Shared bottle at Mi2 at Cardinal 27.10.14. Brown. Beige head. Aroma of sweetness and smoked malt. Similar and complex taste and aftertaste. Well-balanced bitterness.

Shared bottle at "Mandag i annen", Cardinal. Pours cleared brown with thin head. Aroma of smoked malt, malty-salty. Smoked taste, with malty sweetness, some dark fruits, sherry. Maybe a bit too sweet, but nice beer.

50cl bottle. Dark brown, unclear, lacing off white head. Bready, smoky, meaty aroma. Flavor has smoke, sweetness, smoked meat, bready as well, but more in the back. Long warming finish. Surprisingly smoky. Abv is nicely hidden. Slow sipper.

Bottle. Dark brown. Dark malty nose, just a hint of roastedness, soft herbs, beef jerky. Med full body, nice bitters, good slight dark bready malts. Doesnt feel that heavy really, quite easy. Tasty nice. Bit smokey softbitter strong ale.-- bb

500 ml bottle, will soon be available at Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. ABV is 11%. Beautiful mahogany colour, moderate off-white head. Aroma of brown bread, pumpernickel and slightly burnt breadcrumbs, also caramel. Very sweet and malty flavour, loads of caramel, hints of Danish pastry and pumpernickel bread. Very moderate hops. Not a typical Altbier, but okay if you want to satisfy your sweet tooth.
Many thanks for this bottle to Erzengel. Brown pour, mostly white head. Straight forward flavors of caramel, toasted grains, bread, smokey.

Bottle. Pours near mahogny in color wih a tan head. Nuttyness, ripe dark fruits and sweet malty notes in aroma. Dark fruits and malty notes mixed with bit of cocoacoffee and wood in taste. Warming to a certain extent.

Draft, Snallygaster. Large beige head atop clear dark amber body. Aroma is moderately sweet, toffee, caramel/molasses, some bread. Taste is moderately sweet, caramel/toffee, some bread, alcohol, light spicy/earthy. Medium-full body, some stickiness.
Not quite the best brewjob by any means. Lots of barrel. Maroon pour. Sweet, candied malt finish. Tap at Snallygaster.
6 oz draft pour at Snallygaster 2014. Brown with off-white head. Aromas of caramel, toffee. Tastes of toffee, caramel, dark fruit. Medium body with a dry finish.

Sample from bottle @ Bergen Ølfestival. Pours clear brown with a finger thick mocha head. Nice aroma with burned malts, grain and tobacco. Full body with soft carbonation. Flavour is burned malts with dark fruits, tobacco, coffee and vanilla. Dark fruits and wooden barrels in the finish.

Sample at Bergen Ølfestival 2014. 

Dark brownish/amber with a small head. Really a lot of malt in this one, also caramel, light smoke and bread. Alcohol in the finish. Drinkable but a bit heavy in the long run.

Schwer, jedoch trinkbar, wobei das gerauechte Zeug alles kaputtmacht, was dieses Bier bis dato in punctoSchko, Hopfen oder auch Kaffee in petto hatte. An sich ganz gutes Bierchen, doch der Rauchlachs macht alles erarbeitete zunichte.

Bottle from the brewery. Pours out in a deep dark brown colour with low and flat head and medium body. Aroma of barley, malt and smokey hints. Taste of torf, roast, barbecue, nuts, smokey barley and straw. Smokey finish with light hints of Altbier. Expected more / something with less smoke in it.
On tap at Cafe Fiasco, Oslo. Dark copper, creamy head. Sweet maltiness, hints of licorice and smoke. Sweet flavours, smoked notes. Lackig the balance, but drinkable.

On tap @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014. Looks really good with a blurry deep warm copper colored body under a really elegant big lacing head. It has a caramel nose with fruity elements. Something slightly burnt. Quite nice. Tastes nice also. Its both nutty and slightly earthy. Theres caramel that has been blended with red fruits. In the mouth it has a sticky almost syrupy mouthfeel and its only soft and prickling on the carbonation. Ends with more red berries. Lots and of flavor. Yeah, a nice one indeed. 03.05.2014

Keg at the Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014, green session. 03/05/2014. Firstly terrible name. Haxed red / amber coloured pour with a lastingoff white head. Aroma is some smoked malts, rubber, caramel and honey. Flavour is caramel, light smoke. Palate is semi-sweet, mineral water profile. Not great.

Bottle 500ml @ Kristiansand Ølfestival 2014
Pours hazy brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, alcohol, caramel, floral, toffee and hint of chocolate. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long warm, chocolate and caramel finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle, at Kristiansand Ølfestival. As Best Brewjob Ever. It pours a clear, dark amber colored body under a beige, fingerthick head. Meaty aroma with toffee, nuts and some hoppy scents. Bready too, dark, but not rye. It has a light bitterness to deal with the malty flavors, its bready and lightly meaty, with some toffee. Full body, some alcohol warmth, and a nice carbonation level. Malt dominated finish. Sure a nice one, an altbier on steroids, but its done in a fine way. 140823

Sample tray, tap at Café Sara. Lasting patchy surface to a rosewood coloured body. Slim lacing. Nose is semi-sweet malts with hints of liquorice and dark fruits. Malt driven flavours with mid-sweet chocolate, notes of herbal hops. Very smooth, lingering aftertaste with warming alcohol. Tasty sipper (Oslo 18.08.2014).
Mørk gyllen farge. Tynn skum hinne. Duft av malt, gjær og karamell. Fruktig, noe søtlig smak med en anelse gjær og karamell.

Draught @ CBC 2014 [ Green Session ]. - Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014, Sparta Hallen, Gunnar Nu Hansens Plads 11, 2100 Copenhagen, Denmark [ As Freigeist The Best Brewjob Ever ].Clear medium amber color with a average, frothy, good - fair lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, rubber, earthy. Flavour is moderate to light light heavy sweet with a long duration, sweet fruity malty, rubber. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20140503]
Herb würziger, recht süßer Antrunk. Minimal bitter, etwas zuckrig. Dunkel röstig, die geringe Bitterkeit bleibt konstant. Gut! 11/10/11/11//11

On tap at Cafe Sara, august 9th 2014. Dark brown body with a large offwhite head. Aroma of caramel, raisin, alcohol, herbs and grass. Taste is malty with a sweet toffee sting, floral hops, licorice, bittersweet finish with a boozy malt aftertaste.

TAP at Hopfrenreich.
APPEARANCE: clear dark blond beer, nice stable off white head.
NOSE: malty, pilsener? herbs, WORT
TASTE: alcohol, smoked, herbs, never had any thing like this before!

This underwhelmed, given the excitement I was building for it. A bit sweet and syrupy. The idea is interesting but it lacked any nuance. The taste was full and demanding, however. Good beer, just clumsy.

on tap @ Hopfenreich, Berlin - DE. Color: dark brown beer with no carbonation and medium head. Smell: caramel, black bread and smoked malt. Taste: smoked malt with caramel and some peat notes. Aftertaste: smoked malt and caramel. Good beer! I recommend it.

Tap at Hopfenreich, Berlin. Pours dark amber with a small frothy head, aroma is malty with crisp hops. Taste is strong booze, caramel sweetness, dark fruits and pleasant carbonation. Very nice, renovat reminiscent of some strong Belgians with the dark fruit and booze notes, let it warm in the glass a bit
Festival der Bierkulturen 2014. Säuerlich-malziger Geruch. Malzig-süßer Anlauf. Mitte nussig. Abgang malzbitter, röstig, süßlich-aromatisch. Sehr schön.
CBC. Clear brown with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and smoked. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Sweet finish. 030514
On tap at CBC 2014. Amber with off white head. Aroma and taste is malty, sweet, toast, bread, nuts and alcohol.
Draught at CBC 2014. Clear amber colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of caramel, malt, bread and fruits.

3rd May 2014CBC Session 4. Hazy deep amber beer, small pale cream coloured head. Palate is smooth and dry. Light fine carbonation. Smooth sweetish malts - light dry toffee - caramel. Sweet and spicy bubblegum esters. Light dry finish. Nice idea but its clunky.
At FdB 2014. Poured a hazyorange amber with a frothy white head. Aroma of heavy dark fruit, caramel malt, slightly grassy. Full body, flavour of the aroma, fine attempt at hoisting an Alt up in ABV.
Draught at CBC 2014. Clear amber - white head. Tea, carame, toasted, herbal, some bitterness, cammomile, funky notes, kampfer, sweetness, breadish, smokey notes, light metallic, citrus notes.

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2017 [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Köln 2014. Very drinkable ImpAlt, suffused with wood tone and macerate fruit variations: young sherry, oak, whisp of herbal-woody smoke, lush residual sugars and cultured caramels restrained by the mighty dry Alt yeast and oak component. Not a whiff of alcohol, expert brew that merits revisiting.  // Rerate draught @Craft Beer Corner Coeln Feb2017: some tobacco among the bitter chocolate adding character and not diminishing drinkability at this ABV. Nice.
Tap @ CBC, 14. Hazy dark brown/amber with small tan head. Aroma is malt, caramel, toasted and a little smoke. Flavour is malt, caramel, toasted, smoke, meat, little sweet and a little bitter.

UPDATED: AUG 5, 2014 Tap sample at CBC 2014. Clear deep amber-mahogany body, large creamy off-white head, wonderful looks. Aroma is raisins, caramel malts, bread dough, burnt sugar and hints of dusty hops and straw. Taste is caramel, bread dough, dusty hops, burnt sugar and hints of grains and raisins. Full body, medium to high carbonation. Original and quite pleasing from this new German star.

03.05.2014, tap @ CBC:
Small creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly sour-ish smoked, grass, red berries, slightly smoked caramel malts, hay, grain, cereal, hints of smoked ham. Taste is slightly sweet, caramel malts, hay, sugar, slightly smoked grain, chocolate, nuts, hints of smoked ham. Medium bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Fair enough.
From tap. Pours hazy brown with a huge off white head. Aroma is roasted and slight metallic. Sweetmalty, light perfumed. Caramelish and vague metallic. Breadish and slight bitter finish.

Draught CBC 2014. Amber coloured. Unclear. Beige dense head. ARoma. Sweetness, furits, alcohol, bread, caramel. Flavour Fruits, bread, caramel and alcohol. Medium bodied. Ends alcholdense and fuity with a light caramelly touch.
Tap @ CBC, cph. Clear dark amber, medium off white head, great lacing. Malty, sweet, caramel, bread, spicy, alcohol.

Draught at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014, session 3. Deep orange/amber beer with a rick offwhite head. Fruity caramel aroma, hay, grass, biscuits, bready, some apples and grapes. Fruity caramel flavor, apples, grapes, hay, licorice, some banana.

Draught at CBC 2014.
Cloudy orange-red coloured with a huge off-white head.
Fruity aroma of caramel, hay and hops.
Sweet and fruity flavour of caramel, bread and hops.
Hoppy finish.

UPDATED: OCT 25, 2016 Tap at the Copenhagen beer festival.. Deep brown.. Thin tan head... Soft sweet toffee fruit... Rich roast.. Blackcurrant licorice... Dark malts 


Again in bow much as last time... Light smoke
Draught @ CBC 2014. Pours brown with a small offwhite head. Aroma of malt, grain, herbal, grassy hops. Flavor is malt, little sweet, caramel, grassy hops. Medium body, soft carbonation. 030514
Sampled @ CBC 2014. Autumnal red-brown color with a quite thick beige head. Malts, slightly herbal, smokey, slightly sweet-bitter. Average to medium body and carbonation. Ok beer.

On tap at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014. Although i always love altbeirs this one had a hard time coming through. It might of course be because of the setting, a beer celebration isnt always the optimal scene for an altbier. Caramelly sweet with some herbs and citrus.
Sample at CBC. Pours Clear copper, tan head. Aroma of nuts, some sweetcorn. Tast has a little coffee. Very balanced.

Tap @ CBC 2014. Pours murky pale amber with a small creamy off-white head. Aroma is sweet, doughy, bready,caramel. Low carbonation, fine oily and fat mouthfeel. Sweet flavour, caramel, sugary, light vinious. Not impressed.
Pours hazy brownish with low off-white head. Aroma of rye, caramel. Taste is big sweet caramel and toffee. Body is rich and smooth.

Draft at CBC 2014. Pours hazy brown with a small tan head. Aroma is vegetal with smoke, spices, caramel and malt. Flavor is over moderate sweet and light moderate bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.
Sample @ CBC 14. Pours a clear dark amber beer with a massive off white head on top. Aroma is very herbal, lemon peel, cinnamon. Flavor is very herbal again, light sweet. Not really liking it.
